description: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of sin(n*x) (or sin(n*x)/cos(x) if n is even) in ascending powers of sin(x).
references: I. S. Gradshteyn and I. M. Ryzhik, Tables of Integrals, Series and Products, 5th ed., Section 1.335, p. 35.
example: sin 3x = 3 sin x - 4 sin^3 x, sin 4x / cos x = 4 sin x - 8 sin^3 x, etc.
mathematica: t[n_] := (Sin[n x]/If[EvenQ[n], Cos[x], 1] // TrigExpand) /. Cos[x]^m_ /; EvenQ[m] -> (1 - Sin[x]^2)^(m/2) // Expand; Flatten[Table[ Partition[ CoefficientList[t[n], Sin[x]] , 2][[All, 2]], {n, 1, 15}]][[1 ;; 59]]  (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, May 06 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
